alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 3:45PM EST until January 09 at 8:15PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM EST THIS EVENING FOR WATAUGA COUNTY... At 345 PM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain has exited Watauga County. Between 2.5 and locally 4.5 inches of rain have fallen since early this morning, however little additional rainfall is expected. Flash flooding of several small creeks and streams across the county will continue into early evening, possibly making roads impassible. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Boone... Blowing Rock... Beech Mountain... Sugar Grove... Foscoe... Todd... Deep Gap... This includes the following locations... Appalachian State University. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
